page.title: 01Introduction _ Aboyne Area
page.content: The Aboyne Area is a mixture of the village itself and rural surroundings. It presents the undulating Deeside landscape and boasts wooded areas, a loch and a stretch of the River Dee. {Lifestyle}revolves around Aboyne itself, a village of around 1690 inhabitants with a fine display of amenities. {Employment}is found in the village but much of the local farming population stay with farming for the whole of their lives, although the effects of the Aberdeen oil boom are strongly felt. Local{events}concentrate on the tourist trade, culminating in the Highland Games. The actual{inhabitants}of the area are a mixed group. The number of English present a strong contrast to the more established locals.
